metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8649 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
lxc-attach in LXC before 1.0.9 and 2.x before 2.0.6 allows an attackerinside of an unprivileged container to use an inherited file descriptor, ofthe host's /proc, to access the rest of the host's filesystem via theopenat() family of syscalls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8649` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 1.0.8-0ubuntu0.4
lxc - 1.0.8-0ubuntu0.4
lxc-templates - 1.0.8-0ubuntu0.4
lxc-tests - 1.0.8-0ubuntu0.4
python3-lxc - 1.0.8-0ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.8-0ubuntu0.4').
